4. AXUI built-in drivers¶

Page Status:Development
Last Reviewed:

AXUI has implement some drivers for common used platforms

  • windows desktop, based on windows native UIAutomation Client API
  • web, based on selenium project
  • mobile android/ios, based on appium project

4.1. driver for windows UIAutomation API¶

driver for windows UIAutomation API is in driver/windows, we use comtypes to access this windows COM API, thus to use AXUI to automate windows UI, you need install comtypes first.

Windows UIAutomation API separates operations for different kinds of UI into a set of control patterns, it’s recommended to use these patterns to operate target UI, AXUI expose these patterns to end users, anyway end users should need to have a check of these patterns.

Note

I have tested windows driver on win8.1 and win10,

  • it’s works well with windows UI framework like win32, winform, WPF, windows store app
  • not works well with Qt framework, UIA recognize all kinds of Qt controls as frames
  • not support for directX, custom UI controls

4.1.1. How to use identifier to search element¶

Note

inspect tool

4.1.2. UIA element properties¶

4.1.3. UIA element patterns¶

4.2. driver for WebDriver compatible projects¶

selenium and appium all use a C/S structure to support multiple languages, the client side and server side use WebDriver protocol to communicate with each other. since selenium and appium already have python clients, we don’t reinvent the wheel, but use these python clients to implement our drivers for AXUI

4.2.1. selenium¶

Note

Only have some tests with IE with selenium driver

4.2.2. appium¶

Note

since I don’t have an apple/android environment, the appium driver is not tested

I will be very glad someone can have a test for it :)
